newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Nervous Russian MinFins ease following Bradies.
newsitem.headline: Nervous Russian MinFins ease following Bradies.

text.p: Prices of Russian MinFin bonds eased in nervous trading on Wednesday following a fall in other Brady bonds and ahead of U.S. data on jobless claims, dealers said.
"Prices were fluctuating in early trading. They are lower now than yesterday and it could have been selling of just one package that pushed down the market," one dealer said.
Sberbank dealer Pavel Sool said the downward trend in other emerging market debt was behind the dip.
He added the market was uneasy ahead of Thursday's announcement of U.S. jobless claims and after news Russia could start the roadshow for its Eurobond issue only in mid-November.
A strong reaction in U.S. Treasury bond prices to the jobless data could affect emerging market debt prices.
